mainBoard.flavorText: Those who seek to disturb the harmony of life will see their instruments taken from them.
mainBoard.name: Linvala, Keeper of Silence

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

Linvala’s last ability affects only creatures on the battlefield. Activated abilities that work in other zones (such as bloodrush or unearth) can still be activated. Triggered abilities (starting with “when,” “whenever,” or “at”) are unaffected.
No abilities of creatures your opponents control can be activated, including mana abilities.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
Activated abilities of creatures your opponents control can't be activated.

mainBoard.name: Angelic Arbiter

rulings.text: Angelic Arbiter's last ability applies if an opponent attacked with at least one creature during the current turn.

During an opponent's turn, that opponent may either cast spells or attack with creatures, but not both (assuming that Angelic Arbiter is on the battlefield for the entirety of that turn). The player may perform other actions, such as activating abilities and playing lands.
During your turn, Angelic Arbiter's abilities have no effect on the game.

If Angelic Arbiter enters during an opponent's turn, its abilities take actions that player performed earlier in the turn into account, even though it wasn't on the battlefield at the time. For example, if an opponent casts a spell, then you use Leyline of Anticipation's ability to cast Angelic Arbiter as though it had flash, that player won't be able to attack with creatures that turn.

If Angelic Arbiter leaves the battlefield during an opponent's turn, its abilities cease to affect the game. For example, if an opponent casts Doom Blade to destroy Angelic Arbiter, that player may then attack with creatures.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
Each opponent who cast a spell this turn can't attack with creatures.
Each opponent who attacked with a creature this turn can't cast spells.

mainBoard.flavorText: "You have done your best. I give you leave to rest."
mainBoard.name: Emancipation Angel

rulings.text: For Emancipation Angel’s triggered ability, the permanent to return is chosen as the ability resolves. No player may take actions between the time you choose the permanent and the time it’s returned to its owner’s hand.
If Emancipation Angel is still on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, you may return Emancipation Angel itself.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
When Emancipation Angel enters, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.

mainBoard.name: Angelic Ascension
mainBoard.originalText: Exile target creature or planeswalker. Its controller creates a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying.

rulings.text: If the target permanent is an illegal target by the time Angelic Ascension tries to resolve, the spell won't resolve. No player will create an Angel token.

mainBoard.text: Exile target creature or planeswalker. Its controller creates a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying.

mainBoard.name: Guardian Idol

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the last ability of Guardian Idol while it’s already a creature will override any effects that set its power or toughness to a specific value. Effects that modify power or toughness without setting them to a specific value will continue to apply.

If Guardian Idol has any +1/+1 counters on it, those counters will remain on it after it stops being a creature. Those counters will have no effect as long as Guardian Idol isn’t a creature, but they will apply again if it later becomes a creature.

mainBoard.text:
Guardian Idol enters tapped.
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}: Guardian Idol becomes a 2/2 Golem artifact creature until end of turn.
